message.content:
We start by extracting the key numbers from the statements (all numbers are taken from the End_amount amounts):

1. From the balance sheet:
 • Current Liabilities = 7,605,149.91  
 • Total Assets = 23,717,525.01  
 • Owner’s Equity = 16,112,375.10  
 • Inventory = 8,466,430.00  
 • Other current assets (cash on hand, bank deposits, interest receivable, accounts receivable) are given and “Total Current Assets” is 14,619,619.72.

2. From the cash flow statement:
 • Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –967,147.02

3. From the income statement:
 • Main Business Revenue = 775,598.77  
 • Net Profit = 112,375.10  
 • Accounts Receivable at period–end = 321,015.98  
 • (Assuming beginning accounts receivable was 0, the average is (0 + 321,015.98)/2.)

Now we compute each ratio step by step:

————————————————————————————
A. Operating Cash Flow to Current Liabilities Ratio  
 Formula: Operating Cash Flow ÷ Current Liabilities  
 Calculation: –967,147.02 ÷ 7,605,149.91 ≈ –0.1273  
 Rounded to two decimal places: –0.13

————————————————————————————
B. Debt to Equity Ratio  
 Here “Debt” is taken as Total Liabilities. Since there are no non‐current liabilities separately, we have:  
 Total Liabilities = Total Assets – Owner’s Equity = 23,717,525.01 – 16,112,375.10 = 7,605,149.91  
 Formula: Total Liabilities ÷ Owner’s Equity  
 Calculation: 7,605,149.91 ÷ 16,112,375.10 ≈ 0.4719  
 Rounded: 0.47

————————————————————————————
C. Total Asset Turnover Ratio  
 Formula: Total Revenue ÷ Total Assets  
 Calculation: 775,598.77 ÷ 23,717,525.01 ≈ 0.0327  
 Rounded (to two decimal places): 0.03

————————————————————————————
D. Quick Ratio  
 Quick Assets = Current Assets – Inventory  
 = 14,619,619.72 – 8,466,430.00 = 6,153,189.72  
 Formula: Quick Assets ÷ Current Liabilities  
 Calculation: 6,153,189.72 ÷ 7,605,149.91 ≈ 0.8087  
 Rounded: 0.81

————————————————————————————
E. Operating Cash Flow Ratio  
 (Here using the same numerator and denominator as in item A.)  
 = –967,147.02 ÷ 7,605,149.91 ≈ –0.13

————————————————————————————
F. Return on Equity (ROE)  
 Formula: Net Profit ÷ Owner’s Equity × 100%  
 Calculation: 112,375.10 ÷ 16,112,375.10 ≈ 0.006976  
 As a percentage: 0.6976%  
 Rounded: 0.70%

————————————————————————————
G. Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio  
 For this ratio we use:  
 Average Accounts Receivable = (Beginning AR + Ending AR) ÷ 2  
 Here beginning AR is 0 and ending AR is 321,015.98 so average = 321,015.98 ÷ 2 = 160,507.99  
 Formula: Main Business Revenue ÷ Average Accounts Receivable  
 Calculation: 775,598.77 ÷ 160,507.99 ≈ 4.83

————————————————————————————
Now we can present the solution in the required JSON format:

{
  "solution": {
    "operating cash flow to current liabilities ratio": "-0.13",
    "Debt to Equity Ratio": "0.47",
    "Total Asset Turnover Ratio": "0.03",
    "Quick Ratio": "0.81",
    "Operating Cash Flow Ratio": "-0.13",
    "Return on Equity (ROE)": "0.70%",
    "Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio": "4.83"
  }
}
